poem:
**EU-UK Reset**

A jigsaw of promises,  
scattered pieces  
across the table— 

the anticipation of hands  
hovering, connecting—  
a glimpse of growth,  

a puzzle incomplete,  
yet ministers dream  
of a new picture,  

one where hope  
traces the contours  
of a brighter  
economic dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labour will hope EU deal is final piece of jigsaw to boost UK economy Monday’s EU-UK reset deal will not instantly produce the growth Labour sorely needs to fulfil its promise to voters, but ministers hope it marks another step on the road to a more positive economic future. Three aspects of the agreement have been particularly welcomed by business, and form the core of the economic package – although many details remain to be". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
